description:
BEST FOOD AT AT&T. HANDS. DOWN. 

Pricing sucks tho lol. $18.50 for a crab sandwich but you have to consider you're at a ballpark getting a crab sandwich on sourdough bread.

So basically it's a crab sandwich with tomatoes on toasted sourdough bread. You get a pretty long sandwich, cut in half. It's so good you'll be wishing for more. And apparently they're supposed to be opening one up in SFO (San Francisco International Airport) but for now, AT&T Park is the only place you can get your hands on one of these. So if you're enjoying a Giants game, you most definitely need to hit this spot up. 

PS:
You don't need to line up at the Crazy Crab'z booth to get the sandwich. Any booth along the same side as Crazy Crab'z can serve you a sandwich.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Came to San Francisco specifically for the Cubs  vs Giants series and to get my fix in some fresh seafood. 
While Chicago has its share of the food scene, fresh seafood is one of my vices, so I had to try this famous crab sandwich--. Yes it's pricey, yes it's a small sandwich--but oh so worth it-  the crab and toasted and buttered sourdough bread to die for--. I'm actually craving one as I write this.  

I also liked this better then a crab sandwich I had at fisherman's wharf!!!

The line was long ,but it moved really quickly.  

Well worth it!!
author: GabMy J.

description:
My company had taken me out to a Giants game so why not make the most of my opportunity and try the famous crab sandwich. Honestly, it took forever to find for me, since my coworkers and I were literally on the other side of the ball park. 

The sandwich was a pretty outrageous $18.50, but it was sooooooo good. It tasted just like the crabs you would get in Maryland. The portion size was incredibly small, but I guess the price is based off the fact that it was a crab sandwich. 

Probably wouldn't buy it again as it was more for the experience because I can't really justify spending $18.50, but if it was like 13-14 dollars then I definitely would.
author: Timothy D.

description:
Overhyped and a bit underwhelming. I went to the Giants game with my coworkers and she was raving about this place, saying how it wouldn't be going to the Giants game without a purchase of the crab sandwich. It is extremely pricey ($18.50) for this sandwich that will most likely not fill you us. I think I would value it at maybe $15 max. Anyways, this is just a sandwich with toasted sourdough bread (with herb seasoning), real crab meat, and slices of tomatoes. There's a few pieces of shells in the crab meat so be very careful while biting into the sandwich and chewing. 

Definitely just a one and done for me. Don't get this sandwich if you don't like rich creamy mayo and can't afford a sandwich that won't fill you up. Also a bit sad that my sandwich was all cold and not fresh out of the oven.
author: Amy L.

description: Yes, it consisted of real crab. Yes, the sourdough was beautifully buttered and crisp... but 18$?! Yikes! Portion was pretty small. Wouldn't mind the price if i was full because it was delicious.
author: Mary R.

description:
Finally, I had my first Crazy Crab'z sandwich! My friend and I were at the game and decided to try the famous crab sandwich. This has been on my yelp bookmarks forever, so I was excited to try it. I had a concessions voucher to use, but unfortunately this is one of the only places that don't take vouchers!

Anyways, we each ate half of the sandwich and it was so good! Although a bit small (I could definitely finish one by myself,and still have room for garlic fries), it was delicious. Not sure if it was worth the $18 price tag, but tbh I would probably get it again. It is now one of my favorite meals at AT&T Park.
author: Tara A.

description: Still the best crab sandwich I have ever had.  Though pricey, it is worth the expense, as several of us were sitting around, saying the same thing.  The crab is perfectly placed in the bread, which is grilled with some butter.  It is truly a slice of heaven at ATT Park, despite the windy outfield area.  Wished they had better seating though.  But have a beer with it, and you will forget the wind and discomfort.
author: Gerry K.

description:
The Crab sandwich at Crazy Crab'z is legit, it's a rich tasting dungeness crab meat on toasted sourdough bread! The butter toasted bread is delicious, and they have a lot prepared to hand you a sandwich if you're patient enough to wait about 10-15 minutes.

It's totally worth the wait, and at the very least is a sandwich you should get if a)you've never been to a Giants game or b) you've been to a few Giants game w/o getting.....you need to try one!  The dressing is so simple that a slice of tomato is brightens up the sweet crab w a little acid.  

Only complaint is that it's not right off a flat top, but then again the wait would double.  So accept that you're paying $18 for a crab sandwich, and you will not regret this SF classic sandwich!!
author: Marlon T.

description:
I think this place is worth trying for the hype, but it's a one and done for me. I got the crab sandwich which is the hot item on the menu here.

What I liked:
* Pretty tasty sandwich that includes real crab meat. Came warm and fresh.

What I disliked:
* Pricey for the size of the sandwich. I get that it's a ballpark, but man $18.50 for a tiny sandwich made me sad. This will not fill you up at all.
* Too much mayo which overpowered the taste of the crab for me. If you can stand mayo, don't get this sandwich. (My friend couldn't handle the mayo taste, so I ended up eating his sandwich too which I guess is a plus. Still wasn't enough to fill me up though)
author: Michael M.

description: Best food in AT&T park! A little overpriced ($18.50 for two pieces of sourdough bread with crab inside) but still worth. I ate it with the clam chowder (from the same shack) and had an out-of-body experience
author: Yena Y.

description: It's good for those that haven't tried it but not really worth the price. It's mad tiny and will only be a few bites. I wouldn't go out of my way to get one but the crab is tasty. It's probably a half size of a regular half sandwhich so you get the idea for $18.
author: James H.

description: I spilt the sandwich with someone so I could also try the tri tip.It may be pricey ($18.50), and small, but yum! The toasted bread, ( garlic butter?), tomato and crab. Made the Giants loss against the Astros easier to deal with. This is a go to and must try!
author: Amber H.

description:
Oh my gosh. Oh!!!!!!! It was so good. 

I'm not going to lie, I paid my $18 and I was a bit disappointed in the size. It is pretty small. But, it is SO delicious, and actually is the perfect portion because the crab filling is so rich and creamy!

I had no idea what yelpers continued to mean about the any line thing. So, there will be four different vendors all lined up together. One is selling sausage and beer and you can go to any vendor to get this sandwich. Their menu will not show the crab sandwich, but they have them. So just choose the shortest line, because Crazy Crab'z will NOT be the shortest.
author: Nichole M.

description: Got what I expected from an $18 ball park crab sandwich: super buttery and flavourful crab stuffed between super buttery garlic bread. Definitely worth the price point given the deliciousness, but the portion size left something to be desired, like a side of fries. Worth trying if you're on someone else's dime, but I'd take two servings of Gilroy garlic fries (and then some) over this anyday.
author: Kevin N.

description: Delicious, buttery sourdough bread with a heap of saucy crab. It's probably once of the priciest things at the ballpark and in the back of the stadium. Worth the walk and wait. Don't expect to be full from the sandwich though. After about 8 bites, you're done, but you're satisfied.
author: Young Y.

description:
When you go to AT&T Park, there are certain food options that you need to try at some point or another.  The famous crab sandwich at Crazy Crab'z is one of them.  

Facts:

* You can find Crazy Crab'z behind the center field bleachers.
* It's nestled among a lot of other food places and it's pretty much a madhouse with people ordering food before and during the game.
* The line tends to be long, but it also tends to move quite fast.
* You can also order drinks and a few other food items there too.

The sandwich itself is always great -- fresh crab meat with some sliced tomatoes between sourdough bread.  

However, despite how awesome the sandwich is, these guys get three stars.  Why?  For the price you pay (more than $15), the size of the sandwich is ridiculously small.  I finished it before I even got to my seat.  I get that we're in San Francisco and that crab meat isn't cheap, but then again, when you add up the cost of a crab sandwich and a shock top beer (which is what I ordered on my most recent visit to the ballpark), you might find yourself feeling a little apprehensive about splurging on the famous crab sandwich.  I'd say it's worth it if you've never eaten one before and if you're a seafood junkie like me.  But even I don't get a crab sandwich every time at the ballpark due to the high price.  Your move.

3 stars
author: Michael F.

description: Plain and simple but delicious sandwich best crab sandwich.  This is a must eat if you like seafood, crab, and sandwiches
author: Emma B.

description: Do you have a $20 bill in your pocket? It isn't going towards like, rent or food for your kids, is it? Are you hungry? Do you happen to be at AT&T Park? Do you like crab? If you answered yes, no, yes, yes and yes, then move your ass to the Crazy Crab'z stand. Get a crab sandwich on buttery sour dough bread. Be mildly offended that the line took that long even though the sandwiches are sitting there waiting for you. Be irritated that the woman in front of you had 35 questions to ask the cashier. Clench your teeth a little when you shell out 18 whole American dollars for a not huge sandwich. But then sit down and sink your teeth into that sexy bread, and that crab, oh god that crab.... ughhh the combo of buttery crunchy sour dough and crab... you'll forget about the minor irritations induced previously... you might even get back in that line to do it all over again...
author: Liz M.

description: for inside the park it is delicious! the bread is toasted with some seasoning.  plenty of crab with butter.  a slice of tomato.  oh my! the only down side is its a lil pricey.  but hey you in a park and everything is expensive.  so go crazy for crazy crab'z.  AT&T has the best food of any park/stadium.  pro tip, the entire line of food sells everything so you dont have to stand in this line to get the crab sandwich.
author: Matthew G.

description:
Hands-down THE BEST eatery at AT&T park.  Worth the price for the sandwich, particularly since they use real Dungeness crab.  They pile a ton of crab onto perfectly buttered, garlicky, toasted San Francisco sourdough bread.  I get a crab sandwich almost every time I go to a game. 

INSIDER TIP: The lines for Crazy Crab'z are always long, but you can order crab sandwiches from any of the neighboring booths that are connected to Crazy Crab'z.  Most people don't know this, so there's always a longer line for the crab sandwich booth and the others are typically empty.
author: Lauren W.

description: Get the sandwich!!  Delicious crab on toasted sourdough bread. Made being at this beautiful stadium even better.  Get it!
author: sarah l.

description:
This $17.50 Crab Sandwich was quite delicious. It sucks that the portion was quite small. Now that I know where y'all are located, I'll be back again! 

Location: Center Field (behind the bleachers) and yes you're welcome.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I had to try the crab sandwiches which are popular at AT&T Park. The crab was tasty and the toasted buttered bread was really good. It does cost a hefty $18 which seems like a lot for a ballpark, plus the size is a bit smaller than expected. However I would eat it again but would consider it a "treat yo self" kind of situation. There was no line at all when I went to the kiosk at the bottom of the first inning.
author: Jordann A.

description: Best crabsandwich hands down, up, sideways & diagonal. If you are at Willie Maze Park, you gotta stop by here and bless your taste buds with this delicious, delectable as utterly irresistible crab sandwich. You must try it!
author: James L.

description: The sandwich was $18 and I noticed the big sign that read: Crab Sandwiches $18. I've tried most of the food at ATT and I just got into crab a month or two ago. I was actually nervous to try this place thinking it wouldn't taste good. The sandwich was pretty solid but I think it could have been fresher, it looked like it was laying out there for awhile. I took my first bite and it was pretty bad although I felt like it could use more spice to it so I added some Tapatio from Orlando's food shack. The crab sandwich was small and I expected it to be bigger for $18. I think Crazy Crab'z was a one-time thing.
author: Dan G.

description:
$18 for a crab sandwich.  That's crab, mayo, and seasoning between two pieces of buttery sourdough.  $18.

I will say none of the beer available was anything my father would drink so the gentleman that helped us was nice enough to get a draft beer from a neighboring stand.  Points for that.

Located behind the bleachers.
author: Justine D.

description: eh.... I thought these would be really good due to the great ratings on yelp but I didn't look at the photos prior and someone had purchased this for me. I really liked the garlic toast it was served on but the crab was really shredded which I didn't care for and after the first few bites I was over it. The amount of crab you get on the sandwich was a good amount but for $18 a sando and no sides... I'd save my money for a different food spot here.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
Way overpriced, even for ballpark food. It's $18 for probably an 8 inch sandwich, so be aware that you're not going to get full off of it.

That being said, it's the best crab sandwich I've ever had and probably the best food in the park. How could it not be? You've got TONS of fresh Dungeness lump, back fin, and claw meat, seasoned well and not drowning in mayonnaise, with sliced tomato between two slices of thoroughly-buttered, grilled garlic sourdough. They really do not skimp on the amount of crab, even if the sandwich size itself decreases every season. I'll get one of these bad boys probably 50% of the games that I go to.

Be aware that you can order the Crazy Crab sandwich from any line in the row of food stands behind the jumbotron, not just the specific one that shows it on the menu.
author: Jennifer B.

description: First time at AT&T Park last night--all of my friends told me to get the crab sandwich at Crazy Crab'z. Who am I to argue? I love crab! I found Crazy Crab'z right behind the score board on the promenade level. There was no line when I grabbed my sandwich about a half-an-hour before the game started. They had a bunch of sandwiches already made and sitting there waiting for customers. It was good and I'm glad I tried it, but it wasn't so great that I would need one again. The grilled bread was buttery and had a nice little crunch to give some texture to the soft crab. Unfortunately, I also had 3 shells and pieces of cartilage in my sandwich, so there was more texture than I would've wanted. :(
author: Lorianne L.

description: My favorite place at the ballpark! $17 each but worth every penny. I even had a friend who doesn't like crab try it ...and she liked it!
author: Ro N.

description:
Probably the best specialty food item at AT&T Park is the incredible Crazy Crab Sandwich at Crazy Crab'z. Ironically named after the much hated Giants mascot from the 1980's, this version is immensely more popular. They put a warm Dungeness crab salad into sourdough garlic bread - with a tomato slice - and serve it to fans at the game. The stand looks like 4 individual stands, but you can order the Crazy Crab or any other items at any register along the back of the bleacher patio.

The sandwich is just awesome. You can actually taste the real crab with a decent portion. The sourdough garlic bread is messy, but adds extra richness to the sandwich. There are other options including a shrimp sandwich and an open face grilled ahi tuna which also look very tasty. Clam chowder in a bread bowl and decent wine and beer options are available.

The price of $17 seems outrageous, but most Dungeness crab sandwiches outside the ballpark are expensive anyway. The premium and experience are very reasonable. If you are visiting AT&T Park for the first time, this is a must. You can also pair it with a nice Anchor Steam or Junipero gin & tonic from the nearby Anchor stand. Go Giants!
author: Kristian D.

description:
Love the crab sandwich. We get one every game.   These are so much better vs the ones at Woodhouse.

I eat half and it's very rich and filling; then, there is room for bacon wrapped hot dog and garlic fries! 

Cashier Amelia has the fastest line!!  Always go to the far left to order and avoid the long line at Crazy's.

Today's game, vs Colorado,...... Giants lost (:   ...... also got a quilt tote bag for Mother's Day.
author: Foodlover B.

description: I read about this sandwich online and knew I needed to try one next time I visited the ballpark. Can't get enough of this crab sandwich! So good. Makes me poor but so worth it. I wish I could have ate 3 of them! You need to try this sandwich you won't regret it.
author: Jenny S.

description: My favorite meal when watching the Giants.  A ton of crab between two toasted slabs of garlicky sourdough with some thinly sliced tomato for good measure.  Somehow paying $17.50 for a crab sandwich seems like a better deal than paying about $10 for a glorified hot dog (i.e. the Sheboygan brat).  Hot dogs can be really cheap if made at home, but replicating this sandwich with freshly picked crab meat from a seafood merchant is gonna be costly as well.  At first it doesn't feel very filling, but an inning later the bread and mayonnaise catch up with you and you feel quite satisfied.
author: Adam B.

description: I wish I had gotten to take a picture of the sandwich before I scarfed it down! Lol. I was taking in a Giants game at AT&T Park and this food stand is located behind the center field seats (closer to right field I believe) where there's a bunch of food stands. The sandwich was quite pricy, $18 if I remember right, but that's the price you pay for seafood when you're on the west coast. The bread was soft and toasted and the fresh crab meat was pretty amazing!! If I'm ever back there, definitely getting this again!!!
author: Mark S.

description: You have to go to AT&T park and get this famous crab sandwich! It's a must and is so incredibly tasty you will never regret the 17$ that it costs. Delicious, fresh and mouth watering goodness!
author: Jon H.

description: 17.50 for bomb ass crab sandwich... It's pretty small so order 8.50 Garlic fries with it!
author: Sheryl H.

description: Got the crazy crab sandwich for $17.50. The sandwich itself was pretty small, but it was filled with crab and a couple slices of tomato. The flavor was good, the bread had good texture. Probably wouldn't get it again, but had to try it at least once. I also got the fish & chips that were okay. It came with three pieces of fish and thick cut french fries for $11. I'm more of a fan of thin fries.
author: Gretchen T.

description: The grilled crab sandwich and the crab and shrimp sandwich are to die for! We were in the upper levels for the game, and it was worth the walk over! My go to for food in the park!
author: Nicole P.

description:
If you want something different from the usual ballpark food of hot dogs, nachos, fries, and pizzas, Crazy Crab'z crab sandwiches are an excellent (though pricey) alternative. $17 for a measly crab sandwich is highway robbery, but so is everything else at AT&T Park.

The sandwich overall is small and not very filling. However, the crab is delicious and creamy, though loaded with mayonnaise. The downside is that they made fresh crab look almost like canned crab, as my meat was mostly in thin shreds and lacking any large chunks. The buttery, herb-infused, crispy grilled sourdough bread was perfect though.

Yes, Crazy Crab'z was worth a try. No, I will not buy it again. I'd rather spend my money on garlic fries at AT&T Park.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
A great place to hit if you're looking for something besides the typical ballpark fare. I love seafood, so when I read about Crazy crab'z, I had to check them out! It's located on the promenade level upper center field.

Since I had already hit a couple of other food stands, I decided to get the Bridge crab & shrimp sandwich ($13) instead of their signature sandwich. It's actually a pretty big sandwich with a good amount of crab and shrimp! I just wished the bread was toasted so the sandwich was warm. I was expected it to be similar to the Crazy crab'z sandwich except with shrimp. Otherwise, it was still a good sandwich! 

I'll probably be back next time I'm in the park to try the Crazy crab'z. It just looks sooo good!
author: Elena N.

description:
Attended my first Giant's game at AT&T Park as a new SF resident, and I knew EXACTLY what I wanted to eat: a grilled crab sandwich.

This place is located on the 2nd floor, right behind the jumbotron screen. It was quite the trek getting there, but so worth it after I had my first bite into that buttery, creamy goodness. It's lump crab meat simply mixed with some mayo, topped with a tomato slice, sandwiched in between two buttered slices of grilled french bread. 

TIP: You can order the crab sandwich from any of the connecting food stands. So jump in the shortest line!
author: Minh N.

description:
You're seriously missing out if you don't get the chance to eat this during a Giants game. My cousin insisted I try the best crab sandwich she's tasted-- and "best crab sandwich" is an understatement. I was very fortunate to try this piece of heaven-- a generous serving of succulent Dungeness crabmeat and warm tomatoes in between toasted butter brushed (more like smothered) sourdough bread. I could hear a chorus of angels sing on my first up until my last. I already felt like a winner devouring this in all of its glory. I seriously did not want it to end. This is definitely spectacular stadium food.

Did I mention the price? No? Well, let's not talk about it and instead enjoy this blessing on earth. (Honestly, at $16-17, it's totally worth it. With the amount of crabmeat, you're getting what you're paying for. And besides, the only chance you get to eat this is by going inside AT&T Park so it's not like you're gonna indulge everyday-- but I would if money grew on trees).
author: Gia M.

description:
Among the food that is available to the Promenade patrons (not club sections), the Crazy Crab is one of the "only in San Francisco" options that has been around since the park's inception.  It has become a signature item along with the Garlic Fries and the Cha Cha Bo for those who don't frequent the park more than a few times a year.

While I have migrated around the park over the last 14 years, the Crazy Crab still entices me with its buttery sourdough bread.  Yes it is a long walk behind the scoreboard from my seats near the dugout.  Yes the price has gone up 50% to $16.75 for a ball park food item.  Yes the sandwich is about 20% smaller.  if you eat the sandwich you know it is gonna be delicious.  The price of crab has gone up along with the prices.  I do have to say the lines have gone down and for that I am thankful.

For those who want more seafood options they have a shrimp roll sandwich which is overflowing, calamari, and a sourdough chowder bowl.

I do wish they had a location closer to home plate.  

Btw, my other food favorites over the years at the park include the Original Joe's burger, the Sheboygan, and the Caesar Chicken Wrap up on the Club Level.
author: Erik H.

description:
I feel like, you know that you're going to pay an arm and a leg when you go to "entertainment venues". I've never gotten a crab sandwich, anytime I've been to AT&T Park...which is a lot of effing times. 

I came to a pre-season game with my friends. We were late, we were dropped off at the opposite entrance than where we were sitting. Luckily that night, we were sitting in the bleachers...right by Crazy Crab'z. The line was long, but we were starving. 

Obviously, if you go at peak time, which is when we did...you're looking at about a 25 minute wait. In the big picture, that's not long. And like anything worth waiting for, it doesn't last that long. But if you have some good company and maybe an alcoholic beverage, it goes by faster. 

We finally got to the front of the line. My mouth was watering from the smell of garlic bread. I decided to treat my friends to the sandwiches and sodas. From what I've read, prices have gone up to $18 a pop for the grand champion dish. 

For three of those bad boys, two non-alcohol drinks and a beer, it was around $75. Like everyone else has said, it's the size of an appetizer for most of us. I'm glad none of us shared. But it was amazingness in my mouth! I tried to eat it slowly so I could enjoy it all. I'm trying to remember it, I fully enjoyed that sandwich. It will be hard not to go over there every time now for a "starter" dish. Don't be like me and wait ten years before trying one...just do it.
author: Rachel S.

description:
OK yes... a crab sandwich is $17 here... and yes... it looks small - but it is SO SO SO GOOD, and totally worth it. I can barely finish the whole thing - so it is pretty filling!

Note: you don't have to wait in line at the crazy crab - you can wait in any line in that same row of stands, and order your sandwich there :)
author: Michelle L.

description: Every single time we go to a Giants game I get one of these. The line to order gets pretty long so we always cut to the far left vendor and order a beer and sandwich. I feel like they have gotten smaller in the past few years but are still worth every penny!
author: Julie P.

description: This crabwich is absolutely delicious!!! Add some lemon juice and your ready to go.. A game ain't a game if your not enjoying crazy crab'z. It's $18.00 but it's totally worth it. Buy it, bite it, and ENJOY!!
author: Sherrie G.

description: Is it delicious? Yes. Of course it is. It's dungeness crab on toasted buttery sourdough with mayo and tomato. It's simple and it's delicious. The speed of service is fast as hell for ballpark food because they keep the sandwiches prepped and ready. The downside here is that it's an $18 sandwich that is really about the size of a half sandwich when you get down to it. Everyone in our group who tried it liked it, but if you eat one in the first 3 innings, you're going to want something else by the last 3.
author: Carly P.

description: The warm crab sandwich is $17. I got the cold shrimp and crab sandwich for $13.50. It was okay. If you are going to go here, you might as well get the more expensive crab sandwich. I hope this place doesn't keep increasing their prices by 50 cents here and there.
author: Denise C.

description: My goto snack whenever I enjoy an evening of america's favorite pastime. It seems a bit pricey at 17.50 but in terms of the "price inside stadium" versus "price outside stadium" ratio, I think it's a pretty good value. It's a little small, so garlic fries may be a required supplement. But is that such a bad thing? The line goes pretty quickly as well!
author: Andrew D.

description:
CRAB SANDWICH SO BEST
Get at that. Such wow. Delicious much. 

The Crab Crab'z sandwich is one of the greatest sandwiches ever! I recommended it to my friends and they loved it too! Definitely a must whenever going to a game. $17.50 but so worth it...
But Coke for 5$? Weh
author: Marilee A.

description: I just can't... it's so delicious. Only complaint is that you get two pieces that are like 2 in x 4 in. and it's $18 lol. Oh SF...
author: Ashlee B.

description:
Eh. It's good. Just not mind blowing like everybody else is talking about. Honestly, it tasted like a pre-made sandwich. I could care less about it and much rather get a hotdog at another stand, next time. 

If you really want a true crab sandwich, best if you go outside the park and to other restaurants like Woodhouse Fish Co.
author: K S.

description:
It looks small, but you get a decent amount of crab and then you have to factor in the ball park mark up... For me, it could've used a tad bit more salt and/or a side of chips :) other than that I think I made a solid choice choosing Crazy Crab's!

Note, you can order the Crazy Crab'z from the other stands/kiosks within that row... and order things from the other stands as well!  So if Crazy Crab'z line is too long, look for a shorter one.  We also got the fries from one stand over, not bad for steak cut fries!
author: Tina F.

description:
Going to keep this review short and sweet. 

The crab sandwich is amazing. Yes, amazing. Only has two MAJOR problems. It's 16 bucks and you'll finish it with 4 good bites. It's really small. I mean small. Did I say small? Yes, it's small. 

It's very good, but if I'm paying 16 bucks, I want it to last more than 40 seconds of chewing.
author: Benny H.

description:
This is probably my favorite place to eat at AT&T Park.  How can you go wrong with 2 slices of sourdough dipped in ridiculous amounts of butter, grilled on a flat top, filled with delicious crab from the bay?!?!?!?!   You just can't!  

Everything at this ballpark is expensive...if you're going to spend that much money on food here, you might as well go with quality.  Deliciousness.  

There are quite a few stands to the left of crazy crab'z...many people don't know this but I'm about to give away a secret.  You can get in any of those lines to order from ANY of those stands.  The crab line is always the longest...go to the beer line and order your sandwich there.  Don't forget to tip the friendly peeps working hard behind the counter for running back and forth to grab your items though!  

Do it.  Best food here...YUM!
author: Jen W.

description: This is a must go for every Giants game! I would go to a game sometimes just for the sandwich here. Honestly, this is the best crab sandwich ever. The prices have gone up though, I remember when it was only $14, now it's priced at $17.50. It's crab meat with tomatoes on a grilled sourdough. Words can't describe how delicious this thing is, you have to try it for yourself !
author: Rosanna K.

description:
Ordered the crazy crab'z sandwich for the first time.  It tasted pretty good though the sandwiches were pre-made, so it was not like it was hot and fresh off the grill.  I wouldn't normally pay $17 for such a small sandwich but I had a $25 splash ticket to burn.  

What really ticked me off is when I went to purchase some other food later the cashier told me I had no value left on my ticket.  I had to walk all the way to guest services to get it fixed.  They told me they rang up the full $25 at the crazy crab'z stand.  Even then they couldn't just add the $8 value I should've had on my ticket.  They had to have someone escort me to the concession stand to get what I want.  I didn't even use the full $8 and didn't want to bother finding out what to do with the remaining amount.

I missed a good portion of the game.  All this trouble just because one cashier at the Crazy Crab'z stand depleted my full splash ticket value.  My advice, always ask for a receipt showing the balance of your splash ticket after each purchase.
author: Nelson W.

description: $16 for a crab sandwich?!?!? For that price it'd better be the best damn sandwich in the world. Luckily it is. From the fresh dungeness crab meat to the buttery toasty garlicy sourdough bread.... It's ALLLL GOOOOOD! This is always a big treat whenever we hit up Giants games. It just adds to the already awesome experience of being at AT&T Park catching the game and drinking beers. If you find yourself at a Giants game I recommend hitting up Crazy Crab'z, you won't regret it.
author: Chris I.

description:
NEVER again.

Crazy Crab'z = Crazy Runs & we're not talking baseball.

I've been a long time fan of this place, and have always seen their crab sandwiches as an indulgent treat at a baseball game.

I had one last night & was treated to Crazy Runs this morning.  I would let the company know directly, but I couldn't find any way to contact them via the web.
author: Dwight A.

description: Super expensive at like $14... But really good. Definitely on the smaller side, but was enough to share between the two of us along with garlic fries from the other side of park. Wouldn't get this every time I go to the ball park but definitely would splurge once in a while!
author: Tiff C.

description: Omg when I say they crab sandwiches are on point......let's just say you will stand outside in the cold.....shaking and freezing to get this sandwich.  It is so fresh and big pieces of crab.  I was shocked at the quality at the stadium.  Will definitely buy again!
author: Joy C.

description:
First and foremost, I don't eat crab too often. But if I have crab, it's gonna be Crazy Crab'z sandwich! 

If you're going to AT&T Park, you gotta make your way over to Crazy Crab'z. Yep, it's that giant line up ahead. BUT! The line moves quickly and it's the best $16 you're going to spend at the ballpark. 

If you've never tried a Crazy Crab'z sandwich, I would recommend trying it at least once! My mouth is watering as I'm writing this review...yumm
author: Erica L.

description:
$16 for a 6" crab sandwich. It's tasty and worth it but I do wish it was a little bigger in size. The crab is super fresh and the bread tastes and feels like it was dipped in a garlic hinted butter before toasted. #hellaoily but #sobomb 

FYI - there's technically only one stand that markets the crab sandwich so the line is always really long. However, to the surprise of many, every single stand adjacent to the crab sandwich one sells the sandwich (row of 6-7). Gone are the days of long waits pining for greasy crab bites.. Head on over to the stands next door selling lame fries and chicken fingers and I promise you'll have your paws on it in 50% less the time. Then you can cruise by the long line of noobs with sandwich in hand and act like VIP.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
My favorite thing to get at Giants' games are these dungeness crab sandwiches! You get lightly dressed fresh crab meat and sliced tomatoes in toasted garlic sourdough. For $16, I think it's the least overpriced thing at AT&T Park. I've had these both sober and drunk and it's delicious no matter how intoxicated (or not) you are.

(I tried the shrimp and crab sandwich once, but it's not worth the $4 savings you get from the real dungeness crab one. That one was cold, on a hoagie bun, and the quality of the crab meat was definitely not the same)
author: Stacey L.

description:
not sure why it took my 14 years to finally try this place but since then ive got a crab sandwhich every visit. 

pro tip: go to the stand furthest to the left. it is always the shortest line. you can order the crazy crab at any of the 4 food stands.
author: Jack C.

description: Amazingly delicious and so much better than the usual ballpark fare.  Minus one star bc $17 is a bit steep (as is everything at a game) and I had a shell in my sandwich.
author: Megan H.

description: I came here expecting an amazing crab sandwich - worthy of $17 (even at a ballpark) and boy was I disappointed. Maybe Giant fans love mayonnaise and a tiny bit of crab but I was disgusted. I could have done without the mayonnaise and more crab. I also think for that price the sandwich should be larger. People say it used to be. The sourdough wasn't for me also I LOVE garlic bread on it's own. I didn't like the crab sandwich but Everything else I ate at AT&T was absolutely delicious!
author: Ryan B.

description: These are the best crab sandwiches ever!! Yeah $17 is a little steep but it's well worth it!! Yummy worth the line and the money
author: Amy J.

description:
3 stars. Will update or leave the same our next visit.  it was 17$ for a small sandwich w/ crab. & for the location it was fine, but what made it too expensive was the fact that is was cold, & 17$ for a cold sandwich is a no go. Being premade it was still the bomb.com , It just would of been a lot better if it was fresh & warm. I finished most of it, but my girlfriend didn't even finish half due to it being cold even though she barely touched it we both agreed to give it another chance but this time we'll wait for a fresh one lol

Updated 7/2 
4 stars so much better
author: Manzy A.

description: Expensive and small crab sammies ($17), but oh so good!  The garlic bread is nicely buttered and toasted and the crab meat is creamy and perfect.  Enjoyed every bite of it and would totally splurge on this again!
author: Samantha C.

description: The sandwich was only $17. We had it delivered to our seats and it was still warm. With a little lemon on every bite it was perfect! Definitely need to pick one up if your ever at the park.
author: Reina C.

description: Crab, butter, sourdough!!!!!  This sandwich is amazing. My favorite thing to eat while watching a Giants game.
author: Todd M.

description:
Got to the ballpark a little early one game day and figured I would give this place a try for lunch. I was pretty deterred by the price tag but heard tons of great things, SO I crossed my fingers and went for it.  My verdict: In the scheme of overpriced ballpark food I think this is definitely the best option. A large popcorn is $6.50 so $10 more you get sourdough and fresh crab?!... just putting it in to perspective. 

I am a BIG fan of toasted sandwiches with butter on the bread. Think crunchy fresh sourdough where upon taking a bite, butter oozes out.. YUM! Add a large portion (they don't skimp) of crab to this buttery sourdough = a satisfying ballpark sandwich creation. Price is was kept Crazy Crab'z from getting 5 stars.
author: Chelsea J.

description: Hands down the best food stand in AT&T Park.  If it wasn't at a baseball game, I would say it is a little pricey, but it did live up to the hype so it was well worth the $17.  Located behind the bleachers, there wasn't too bad of a line.  I will definitely get this again next time I am at AT&T Park.  Be aware that it is not a huge portion, but when is anything cheap at a sporting event?
author: Justin Y.

description:
The crab sandwich was tasty, but tiny. For $17.50, it was not worth the price. I wish the sandwich were either bigger or cost less. It's good to try once, but I'd probably rather bring food in and get a good sandwich that's significantly larger elsewhere for less than $15.

The clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl was also tasty. But there was way too much bread and not nearly enough soup. Again, not worth it for the price I paid. With the option of bringing in outside food, I'd recommend doing that rather than buying overpriced food here.
author: Erica C.

description:
We went to AT&T Park to watch the Giants play as part of a work sponsored outing. They gave us bleacher seats and $12 loaded onto our tickets for food and drinks, so naturally, I went to one of the more expensive places in the park go get my moneys worth!

The crazy crab sandwich that everyone's raving about was $15 and I wasn't really feeling like munching on a butter-soaked sourdough bread sandwich with crab in between (while as delicious as it sounds, I thought it might be a bit too heavy and greasy for my stomach since I've been trying to eat healthier). Instead, I opted for the Crab Louie Salad. It came with salad greens, a hard boiled egg cut in half, a couple slices of tomato, a couple lemon wedges, and a large helping of their crab mixture (chunks of crab meat, mayo, and some other spices). They put the dressing on the side in a little plastic container.

I used the lemon wedges and a small bit of the dressing and it was perfect. The crab mixture was quite tasty and I loved that it despite the mayo, it was a healthy option at the ball park!

NOTE: The line was super long, but I think it's worth it, especially if you have a buddy with you to chat with!
author: Leana L.

description:
To make up for an epic fail of a meal we had at the Tres Agaves booth, Rebecca and I scrapped our nachos and splurged on a Crazy Crab'z Grilled Sandwich. We were already starving and had thrown away money, this better be good.

And....it was. I'm a big fan of fresh crab and was happily surprised with my half of a crab sandwich. It was toasty, fresh and flavorful. It was tiny compared to  I would be happy to save my time and go straight over to the Crazy Crab'z booth.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Buttery, fattening, full of fresh crab meat, heart attack on a plate, combined with the SF Giants... I mean come on!
author: Shumai P.

description: Worth waiting in line. Little on the pricey side but worth it once you take a bit. If at the ball park a must have.
author: Lori B.

description:
So...let me get this straight...a Bud Light costs more than $10 nowadays and people are seriously complaining about $16 for a sandwich made with real crab?!

To me, a Giants game is not complete without one of these morsels of garlic-buttery seafood goodness. (Make sure to stuff your pockets with napkins before heading back to your seat.)

Pro-tip: Order from any of the lines in that section of the outfield to save yourself some time.
author: Laura H.

description: DELICIOUS CRAB SANDWICH!! Yes, expensive for a crab sandwich but all ballpark food are overpriced. The $16 price tag for a dungeness Crazy Crabz sandwich was well worth it and good to the last bite! The grilled buttery sourdough bread was amazing and there was a generous portion of crab in the sandwich. The sandwich was smaller than I expected, I could have ate 2 or 3. I highly recommend!  (This is the only stand in the ballpark that sells crab sandwiches.)
author: Lynn T.

description:
Wow. Just... wow.

Seriously? $16 dollars for a puny sandwich? I wish they gave more! But regardless, taste-wise... it was too freaking delicious. Greasy? Yes! But I ate every last bite of that greasy, savory crab-succulent sandwich. Every. Last. Bite. This thing puts all other crab sandwiches to shame. Served on San Francisco's own sourdough bread, this is one ballpark food you don't want to miss.

I don't even particularly like baseball, but I'm already looking forward to the next game I go to. Go Crazy Crab'z! I mean....... Go Giants!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
As far as ballpark food goes this place is delish! 

The line goes quick because looks like they pre make these and keep them on warmers. It is expensive but you are at the ballpark so deal with it. Around $16 for the crazy crab sandwich and you get two pieces which aren't that substantial in size but they use real Dungeness crab and butter up the sourdough bread pieces so each bite is packed with good buttery crab flavor! Don't forget to squeeze the lemon pieces onto the sandwich first as I feel it brings out the crab flavor more. 

This sandwich didn't fill me up and my friend and I actually finished our sandwiches while we were waiting in line to get more beers and garlic fries lol

I would get this again but it wouldn't be good as a filling dinner meal option on its own. It's a great and expensive snack or appetizer :)
author: Christine W.

description:
Legit crab sandwich with tomato slices on garlic sourdough bread.  

Worth every penny.
author: Emily J.

description:
There are a couple must have's at AT&T Park and the Crazy Crab sandwich is one of em! For a whopping $15 bucks you get fresh crab topped with tomatoes, sandwiched between two garlicky & buttery grilled sourdough. Garnished with a lemon wedge that's never needed cause it's just that flavorful!

GO GIANTS!
author: S Y.

description:
I am so impressed with AT&T Park's food offerings. The crab sandwich is legit. At $16.75 a pop, it's high end fare even for a ballpark dining option but so, so delicious. If it wasn't so pricey I'd get two for me and two for my guy but then you'd have to roll me out of the ball park.

Our seats were on the opposite side of the Coke Bottle where the stand is located. But that journey was worth it. 

Live a little, go get it!
author: Susie S.

description: I get to go to so few games nowadays.  But when I do get down here, this is my go to sandwich.  Grilled buttered sourdough with a generous portion of crab and sliced tomatoes.  it doesn't get much better than this.  Go ahead and splurge seafood lovers.  You deserve this.
author: Maria S.

description:
Thanks to a recommendation from Wilhelm Y., I pickd up a Crazy Crab'z sandwich - dungeness crab and tomato in between slices of grilled, buttered and garlic'd sourdough bread.  The sandwich is delicious - rich, creamy, fresh and served warm.  

This lovely creation is pricey ($15.50) and not very big but in terms of quality, it's fantastic and definitely a San Francisco treat!
author: Melissa L.

description: So I came here after hearing this was the place to eat at the ballpark.  Not sure why I thought there could be above average food for a fair price at a ballpark but this certainly isn't the place.  First off the signature "crazy crab sandwich" is $17.00!!!!!  For that price I expect the best crab sandwich I have ever eaten.  I was disappointed.  Not that the sandwich was bad but the crab that was used smelled and tasted like it was from a can. I have had much better crab sandwiches than this and will never go back.  $17.00!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I suggest you grab a bite to eat before the game.
author: Mike V.

description:
It's freaking expensive. But what ISN'T overpriced at this ballpark?!

However for the amount of crab meat it was worth it.

It's one of the best damn things to eat here
author: Susy C.

description:
Amazing hot crab sandwich!  The tomatoes are hot too, and it is delicious!

I was bummed to see this season the price went up to $16, but I still couldn't help myself because it's such a rare treat.  It's also a very filling sandwich, so it probably evens out to the nachos and hot dog and churro and all the other stuff you might normally get at a game.
author: Gabrielle L.

description:
Location: AT&T Park below the Coke Bottle/behind the bleachers
Items to Order: The Dungeness Crab Sandwich; Clam Chowder in Bread Bowl (shorter line than Boudins)

The sandwich is really good but $15; and i swear it's gotten smaller and smaller. It's definitely not filling enough for someone who has a big appetite compared to some of the other food options but go try it !
author: Jenn Y.

description: If it weren't for the steep $16 price for a measly sized Crazy Crab'z sandwich I would give this place a higher rating. I was one of the many loyal Giants fans instantly attracted to the Crazy -Crab'z stand by the wonderful smelling aroma of grilled garlic-butter sourdough and juicy red tomato atop a savory dungeness crab sandwich. The price is steep for such a small sandwich, but I was very very satisfied with my purchase. I wish I was disappointed with the sandwich,  that way I wouldn't have to dish out an extra $16 for food every time I go to a game...
author: Elaine N.

description:
I love their crab sandwich! If you think one order will suffice, better think twice. The bread is buttery and not hard. The crab is lumpy, not finely chopped. It's not over seasoned as to highlight the natural sweetness and flavor of the crab. 

People, you can get in line from any of the food vendors from that same area. That is highly recommended and a good advise because if you think you can only get in line from one spot, you are wasting valuable eating time! 

This is a must try!!
author: Malou M.

description: I am crazy for this sandwich. I always get one or two of these guys whenever I am at the ballpark. I just wished they sold them outside the park too. That would make my day. I sometimes dream about this sandwich too. #realworldproblems
author: Anthony D.

description:
THIS IS WHAT PURE HEAVEN TASTES LIKE.

Crab Sandwich. Yes, it is $16. And yes, IT IS WORTH EVERY PENNY!!! 

I darn well nearly cry from gustatory overload while eating this succulent gift from the gods. So simple. But SO DELICIOUS!!

Really though, you should try it.



DISCLAIMER: I have never been sober while eating one of these.
author: Sally T.

description: A must eat at spot if you ever stumble across a Giants game. Buttery goodness on a perfectly toasted bun with savory crab and tomato that makes your mouth water. Be prepared to spend $17 tho but how often can you walk into a baseball yet alone any stadium and grab a crab sandwich? I always find myself buying one whenever I go to a Giants game and never disappointed eating this beauty.
author: Moses D.

description: Delicious crab sandwich, WAY better than any hot dog!
author: K M.

description:
I love this sandwich.  But it's like buying a pair of Jimmy Choo shoes - you are paying too much!  The buttery, toasted bread and skimpy serving of crab is wonderful with tomatoes.  I shared one with Hubby and regretted doing that.  It's NOT meant to be shared, it's not big enough for sharing. YOU have to eat it all yourself and maybe spend another $16 to eat another to feel full. But, geez, $32 for 2 sandwiches?

At least if you buy Jimmy Choo shoes, you can wear it again.  So, I don't buy these sandwiches that often, just once in a Blue Moon as a treat.  It's like an appetizer portion!
I would lump it up there in the "Highway Robbery" list - Jimmy Choos and Crazy Crab'z crab sandwiches.

OK, they raised their prices, it's now $16.75 for a 6 x 2 inch sandwich.  The stranger standing behind me waiting to buy, was saying it was about  "2 bites".  I told him they should be shot for charging so much.  He joked that he should be shot for paying for it!  Still, there was a long line waiting for it after I got mine.
author: Ry T.

description: Holy crab. Hahaha. Seriously the most amazing crab Sando in the world. Yeah it's worth it. Go get one now!! Seriously you are wasting time and they can run out. Go!
author: Joseph M.

description: I have been to my share of Giants games and I have devoured my share of crab sandwiches. It still blows my mind that this delicious creation is at a ballpark. It is so good that I went to a football game a couple of months ago, at AT&T, and they weren't serving the sandwich and I was crushed.
author: Josh N.

description: What's not to love about Crazy Crab'z crab - great creamy crab, lots of flavor, sourdough bread that is buttered - but is it my imagination or are these sandwiches shrinking and the price is the same?  Is it because it isn't crab season?  I will be testing this theory.
author: Maile N.

description:
Update:

I have come to my senses and added a star to my former 3 star rating. I've found myself gravitating towards this sandwich whenever I'm at the park. I don't eat anything else there but this and garlic fries (of course). I still wish it was a tad bit bigger considering what you pay, but it's cool. Hence, not 5 stars. I now appreciate the greatness of this sandwich.
author: Abigail D.

description: Tried the Dungeoness crab sandwich on sourdough. A bit pricey at $16 but was very tasty! Very rich buttery goodness and huge chunks of crabmeat. I think it's worth the splurge. I mean, why not? You're at AT&T park :]
author: David D.

description:
$15.50 for a Sandwich... Am I crazy? Yes!!!

*Crazy crab'z sandwich - REAL Dungeness crab meat with mayo, 2 slices of tomato, in a grilled garlic butter sourdough baguette. Lemon wedges on the side. . .  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N_duEepJN6ZwHyf_s6ZBZA?userid=NOKodUWSTYVUEpqBRCOfKw)

I loved how I could taste the crab in each bite. The crab meat was shredded to a good size (where it was still recognizable) & it wasn't overpowered by the mayo. The price isn't too bad when compared with other food options in the park. I would rather pay a few more dollars for something mouth watering rather than average. 

As I sat in my seat eating this delicious sandwich I was wondering why in the world it took me so long to find it existenced! This sandwich is a definite must when you're cheering on the world series champs!

*Location - food court behind the bleachers
author: Nicole S.

description: This sandwich is a must at least once! It seems like the more popular they get the smaller the sandwich becomes but it's still enough to fill you up. Please add another location, the line is always crazy long!
author: Jen W.

description:
Went to the Giants game on a Saturday afternoon. Beautiful weather and beautiful stadium. This was my first time to the stadium as I am a out of towner. Walked by the Crazy Crab'z and we couldn't resist. It was a little pricey but it is all dungeness crab on yummy garlic sourdough bread.  They add lemon wedges on the side that just really ties it all together. 

This was by far one of my favorite things I had in SF all weekend and to think it was at the stadium!! Can't find food like this just anywhere let alone at a ball game! My boyfriend and I really wanted to get another one but we refrained since we have been eating machines all weekend long. 


Overall: Too good to share! Get your own. $16.25 but worth it.
author: Ida A.

description:
It is a bit pricey at $15, but the Crazy Crab'z Sandwich is one of those things that every crab-loving baseball fan should try.  Located in the plaza behind the center field scoreboard at AT&T Park, this concession serves up some delicious crab salad creations.  For $10.50 you can also have cold crab salad on a sandwich roll, but I like the Crazy Crab'z (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N_duEepJN6ZwHyf_s6ZBZA?select=WnojAceLNwKR4CUGhhAvLA) the most.

Two long, garlic buttery baguette slices are grilled to order with a good portion of crab salad made simply of crab meat, diced red onions, diced celery and dressing with tomato slices placed on top.  Served with a lemon wedge, I often devour my sandwich on the spot before the gusty winds at the ballpark even get a chance to cool off my sandwich.  The crab meat is so sweet, and there is very little of the onions, celery and dressing.  It's definitely far more enjoyable than watching the Giants' pitchers try to find the strike zone.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Update:  May 11, 2009 - This sandwich is so good it's featured in Woman's Day magazine as one of the "Best Signature Ballpark Foods in the U.S.  Check it out ~ http://www.womansday.com/Articles/Food-Recipes/Best-Signature-Ballpark-Foods-in-the-U.S.html
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: First time having the Crab sandwich, oh my god was it amazing! Line was long but totally worth the wait and it went by pretty quick. If you're at the park and can't decide on where to eat definitely come here and have the crab sandwich. We got a side of fries and some beers with it! Delicious! And what's nice is that the sandwiches are small so it's not too much food at a ballgame!
author: Ema S.

description: $15.50 crab salad sandwich with toasted buttery goodness sourdough-like bread. Really delicious but expensive enough to only want to try once. 'Nuff said.
author: Alysha K.

description: The food is 5 stars, the service I experienced today was 1 star. Overall a must eat. The crab sandwiches are literally amazing and worth every penny of the 17 dollars! The lady helping me put a water on my bill rather then a coke when I told her I wanted a coke and not water she tried to say there's nobody here to return the water so you're basically stuck with it. I definitely wasn't going to have that. Guess what she found someone really quick made the exchange but to make a customer have to take something was wrong. Doesn't change how I feel about the food and will not stop me from coming back. But it did cost them a star, sorry Crazy Crabs, Customer service should always be your number one priority!
author: Mo T.

description: I think the reviews here pretty much cover it.  $17.50 for a crab sandwich and it's pretty darn good.   The bread is buttery and toasty, the crab was fresh.   I don't agree with some of the other posters - I thought the portion was ample.   Not sure I'd eat here every time I'm at the ballpark, but it belongs in the rotation.
author: Jeffrey D.

description: It's a tasty appetizer that doesn't qualify for being considered a sandwich.  It is about 1 1/2 x 3 inches wide.  You get 2 pieces for $18.00.  Surprised there haven't been more outrage.
author: Susan G.

description: I kid you not, this crazy crab sandwich altered the space/time continuum for me. SO WORTH EVERY PENNY IT COSTS. YEP, ALL 1,700 PENNIES.
author: Natalya C.

description:
Pretty much tits between garlic bread. 

It's orgasmic. And ranks pretty high on the addictive scale. It's pretty much the best thing you can get there at the ballpark, beside the garlic fries.

But kinda expensive. (But that's ballpark food for ya) Just like taking a girl out on a date, you get teased, get a little taste, you come home, and you just end up wanting more later. SUCKS.
author: Joon Y.

description: Going to the game?  Then you gotta get some Crazy Crab'z. This ridiculously delicious Dungeness crab salad sandwich served in buttered, grilled sourdough will get you in the right mood to cheer for Giants baseball. It doesn't get any more SF than Dungeness crab on sourdough.  And with this sandwich you get big meaty chunks of it smothered in a sauce that's not too creamy nor too tart.  The sandwich itself is a good medium size and a bit on the pricey side. But it tastes so good I'm amazed the vendors are able to rock them out fast enough to fill everyone's order. Find the Crazy Crab'z booth in the center field bleachers, where all the crazy fans sit.
author: Eileen P.

description:
Location: I am not a frequent visitor of AT&T park.  A lot of the reviews skip on where this place is located. It's under the coke bottle behind the bleachers.  

I don't think I can say much that hasn't already been said. The buttered sour dough bread with a good portion of crab and tomato was delicious. I could feel my heart clogging with every bite. The butter oozes out of the bread and soaks the crab in your mouth making is a great sandwhich.  Maybe it was because it was a bit cold but the bread wasn't that warm. That is my only reason for not giving it 5 stars.  It was still nice and crispy but just a little cold. I would definitely split this with someone so you can also get other items in that area.  TRY IT AT LEAST ONCE!
author: Ken W.

description:
$15 might be a little steep for a sammy but the crab sandwich on butter grilled sourdough is reallllllly good.  I kept drooling as I waited in line and saw the people ahead of me walk away with their mouth watering crab sammy.  The plan was to share one, but once my boyfriend saw people devouring their sandwiches, he didn't want to share anymore...hahaha, so we just got two and I'm glad we did.  I wouldn't want to share either.

Like one yelper mentioned, if you're willing to pay $30 to park your janky car in the lot, you can afford $15 for this crab sandwich, specially if the Giant's are winning and you're feeling good.
author: Anna Liza P.

description:
$16.50 for 2 small pieces of sourdough bread, 2 slices of tomato, some pieces of crab and mayo.  And it does not come with any bevarage.

I'm not sure what the big hype about this place is, but for $16.50 I can get a whole crab and a 6 pack of beer.  Hell, for $20 I can get a whole lobster.  Definetely not worth the price.  I rather get some garlic bread from Safeway put it in the oven and steam a whole crab and drink some beers for that price.

Taste wise.. it was A-Ok. 

Plus stars for the quick service.  But heck I'll be quick too if people are willing to spend that much on this item.  Another "Why didn't I think of this?" moment...
author: Elliot Y.

description: There are two main sandwiches that they sell here - the Crazy Crab sandwich & the crab & shrimp sandwich. I recommend getting the Crazy Crab sandwich. It's only 3 or 4 dollars more, but definitely way yummier :) It's also warm, which is great for when you're watching the game on a chilly SF day.
author: Alice H.

description:
I have to say, I used to be in love with the Crazy Crab'z sandwiches. Even when they are the most expensive thing in the park, I still believed they were worth the time waiting in line and the price, and I would get them at almost every game I went to. 
Today, I actually decided to never go back and get another Crazy Crab'z ever again. The price of the sandwich is now $16.75, and the size has decreased dramatically, and I mean like 1/3 smaller than what they used to be. I don't even think a child would be full from eating the portion size they serve now! The tomato was completely over ripe and disgusting, and they actually forgot to fry one side of our sandwich so we were stuck with garlic butter on one side. We didn't even bother getting a new one, it wasn't worth my time making my way through the crowd and we just wanted to get to our seats. 
It's depressing me just to have to write this review, but it's definitely not what it was 3 years ago when I gave them 5 stars.
author: Jillian O.

description: $16.50 for a mediocre sandwich.  I thought the sandwich was just way too greasy and the crab/mayo mix was bland.  Everything is overpriced at the park, but I would rather get a bratwurst instead.
author: Jenn W.

description: All the pics & great reviews are accurate, folks. I eat one of these bad-boys everytime I go to the game. Its the best crab sandwich I've ever had, no doubt about it!! I'd go to the stadium during the off-season just to buy these if they were open -HA!! HA!!!
author: Alex H.

description:
Went to my first Giant's game last week and HAD to try Crazy Crab'z.  Came pretty early and got food right away so the line was fast.  

The crab sandwich was delicious!  LOTS of fresh crab meat that wasn't too mayonnasise-y on a thick, garlic'ed and buttered sourdough toast with a lemon wedge.  I'm pretty picky about my seafood but I loved it and ate the whole thing before the BF came back with his hot dog and garlic fries, ALL MINE!

FYI, its located in the bleachers section sooo lap around or just buy bleacher tickets...?  Also, we had a crab sandwich after the game at the Fisherman's Wharf and it did not compare.  The only thing is its in the ballpark and fifteen bucks but it's definitely good ballpark food :D nom nom nom!
author: Sam L.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of any kind of seafood, but this place (in AT&T park) is quite pricey. $16 for a sandwich that is quite small. If I didn't have such a soft-spot for seafood I'd be turned away from this food cart, but alas I was sucked in to the fresh crab. Although the "dungeness crab sandwich" was cheaper ($14)  by asking around everyone told me to splurge for the Crazy Crab sandwich so I did. It is junk food heaven, the sourdough is cooked to crisp and made golden yellow by the amount of butter on it. The amount of crab in it is a bit disappointing for $15, but it's AT&T park and the jack everything up.

I'm glad I tried it, but I'd definitely think twice solely because of the price and not so much for the quality of food. The sandwich was great.
author: Alice H.

description: Yummy!!  Best food at the ball park.  The price is steep but hey its crab!!  even when I sit in the fancy seats I make my way down for one of these warm and buttery treats.  If you go early the line is not always as long.  Try one you will not be disappointed!
author: Sunny K.

description:
The Yelp reviews were right on.  I had to try this, and am glad I did though I don't think  I will go back.

Was good--filled with chunky crab.
Was tiny.
Was expensive (as in, disappointing value).

My reaction was: "$16 just for that?"

Alas it is crab, and though I don't have the pleasure of eating crab rolls frequently, I am guessing that these sandwiches are usually not cheap anyway. Plus the AT&T Park markup.  

But now that I've tried it, I can move on.  I'm going for the Cha Cha Bowl at the booth across the way next time.  

Go Giants!!!
author: Erika S.

description:
This sucker sandwich was $15 bucks? Wow, I didn't even know. 
I went to my first Giants game last night. Basically a group of my friends went to wait in line for what they called a sandwich. They asked if I wanted one, I said sure. Basically they were the ones that bought it for me. 

The line was long as hell. They took forever while waiting for them. 

 

Also, I thank god for having good friends. As they paid for my sandwich. But now I know I owe them big next time I bring them out. FML
author: Eric Y.

description:
Some things are worth any price. This crab sandwich is not one of them.

Good? Yes.
Memorable beyond, "Holy **** I just spent $16 on a tiny sandwich?" No.

The stand is under the Coke Bottle in the outfield. Tip: You can buy the sandwich at any of the windows connected to the Crazy Crab Shack, including the beer window six windows down.
author: Alexander J.

description:
After purchasing a crazy crabz sandwich, I overheard a random man say: "Hell no I'm not paying 16$ for a sandwich, I could get a steak for that price." I then looked down at my sandwich and thought to myself: why did I buy you? haha 
However, all feelings of regret were negated after taking that first bite - it was mesmerizing. While this sandwich is not worth the price, I have to admit it was damn good. The buttery toasted bread, creamy crab, and tomato combine to create a masterpiece in your mouth...I admit, however, the crab could have been replaced with tuna salad or chicken salad and it would have tasted almost identical....
Nonetheless, this is a great sandwich to splurge on at least once in life. YOLO.
author: Mary K.

description:
Can you believe that I actually took my son to a Giants game with the primary motivation being to try a Crazy Crab'z sandwich?  This kid is ruled by his stomach!

Thankfully, the sandwich did not disappoint.  Though it was small, it is awfully rich. My son graciously allowed me a bite of this petite masterpiece.  Yum!  The crab, the bread, the butter, the garlic, the tomato all combine to create perfection.  This truly is a must try at the park.

As for the price, yes, it is expensive.  But everything in a ball park is. If you buy your tickets online, use the promo code SplashTix.  You will get $12 towards food for $10.  Voila!  Your sandwich now costs $13.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Kinda pricy and a bit of a long line, but man...once you get yours...you'll realize it was worth the (mild) wait.
author: Dan B.

description:
This is my pit stop for food before the game starts. Forget hot dogs and beer, you'll find me in line at Crazy Crab'z for their crazy crab sandwich and a cup of wine. I think this petite sammy is really enjoyable and the insane line this stand creates is my proof. 

$15.50 for a small sandwich is pretty pricey, but what isn't pricey at the ballpark. This crab meat sandwich is served on garlic butter sourdough, bedding two slices of tomatoes and then grilled to a finish. A must try!

Just a tip, grab extra napkins for this meal because it's slightly messy to eat; it will leave the fingers a bit greasy.
author: Jenny K.

description:
It's pretty simple.  Dungeness crab in mayo with a little seasoning.  Two pathetic slices of tomato.  Two ever-shrinking slices of garlic butter slathered sourdough baguette.  With a lone lemon wedge.

Yes, it costs $15.  I'm also 90% certain that the portion get smaller every year.  I know for a fact that they did between the 2010 NLDS and my first game of 2011.

$15 can buy me a lot of other things at the park.  Like... almost two beers.

I wish I hated them.  I wish they tasted terrible.  I wish I had the wherewithal to just settle for a Bratwurst and Garlic Fries.  I wish I was so incensed by the ridiculous price and the ever reducing portion size as to stand up and say "No, Crazy Crab'z stand!  I do not approve of this injustice and will refuse to patronize your establishment!"

::sigh::
author: Jason H.

description:
Well, Yelpers promised me I'd like this splurge, and I did. wow. 4 ounces of fresh crab, dressed with light mayo, topped with a few thin tomato slices, and thrown on top of two gloriously crunchy greasy thin slices of garlic bread. I detest tomatoes - just below celery on the Food Chain Axis of Evil for me - so I asked to refrain. That out of the way... well, bliss at the old ballgame.

I often note that a sign of a great meal is how quickly I eat it, especially after the first bite, and I wolfed this down so fast just so that I wouldn't have to share. (Yes, I am awful.)

Sadly, it'll probably be the last time. $15 is a ridiculous amount - I could buy a whole crab somewhere with that money! [where? mm... an asian market or restaurant... yeah.]

The blonde cashier lady was super nice and patient as she described the difference between this one and the $10.75 Dungeness crab sandwich. The second she said it was 'cold' and pointed to a shelf on her left that had crazy condensation and limp looking bread, I literally decided to eat that $4. That's my story and I'm sticking to it.

btw, the line isn't always that long! be patient. i went at the top of the second inning and there was just one other couple in front of me.
author: Steph C.

description: After thinking about purchasing a crab sandwich from the Giants game for years, I finally took the plunge and ordered the $16 sandwich last weekend. I opted for the Crazy Crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N_duEepJN6ZwHyf_s6ZBZA?select=GJXKTa2TjEm41meJo4NhTg#jv9-73oTrSB9LwopY7M56w), which was essentially crab salad and a slice of tomato sandwiched between two small slices of sourdough soaked in oil, with some pieces of parsley and other herbs to give you a sense of greenery. I can't say I regretted my lunch, but my arteries probably did! You could taste and feel the butter seeping out of the bread with every bite, but it was scrumptious for the couple of minutes the sandwich lasted. The crab salad inside was seasoned well, although on the mayo-y side (if you like mayo like I do then you won't mind). Overall, I would say the crazy crab sandwich is good, but is a splurge for both the wallet and the cholesterol levels. However, definitely give it a try! Note you will likely have to wait in a long line that moves slowly. I will have to come back later on this season to try the cold crab sandwich..
author: Amy D.

description: Really good sand which, pricy but worth it!  No need to stand in line because you can order a sandwich from any of the 4 vendors in the line with the sandwich place!
author: Tim C.

description: Best crab sandwich of my life. It was amazing. Don't let the size or the price deter you (it is a baseball park after all). Months later I still crave the sandwich I ate there.
author: Karsten B.

description:
4 solid stars for there crazy crab sandwich

the price is a steep $15.25, portion wise I believe it is not enough but they have the taste to back up that cost. buttered thick slices of garlic bread toasted to have a crunch on every bite the filling is not that bad also, dungeness crab with mix of creaminess and rich taste, full face flavor of that crab overpowers the mix but done very well.

sandwich wise again it is not large but it gets the job done in making you want more. 

this is a definite spot to hit up and try there signature sandwich I definitely recommend it if you are watching one of the games at AT&T park

food **** for their crazy crab sandwich definitely must try pricey and small portion but the taste is overpoweringly good haha
price $$ =(
service ** at the park they need to organize it better letting folks know you can get it in all lines listed in this paticular section, DO NOT order the crab sandwich and have a beer to wash it down, mayo and beer are definitely not a good mix just get the sandwich and enjoy a soda or water
author: Clarence A.

description:
BEST SANDWICH EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This sandwich is freakin' fantastic, but sooooo expensive- $15. Most times I pay alot less for my ticket for the ball game, then for this sandwich. I must admit, I do feel kind of guilty shelling out 15 dollars for an itty bitty sandwich, cuz there are poor children all over the world dying of hunger, but as soon as I bite down on the delicious sandwich, all my guilt goes away. I love to have it with a beer, best combo. Love it!
author: Magdalena G.

description: I finally had one last time I was at the park because a friend was jiving for one pretty bad, I was always put off by the $$.  I wasn't disappointed at all, tons of yummy crab in a sourdough sandwich.  Will I get it again? Sure, but not every single time I go to the yard.
author: Tom Y.

description:
$15.50 for an expensive, tiny, super unhealthy....yet fantastically delicious crab sandwich. There must be at least a stick of butter in each sandwich. If you ever visit AT&T park, then this is definitely a must have....at least once.

They also sell a cold Crab Sandwich. I don't know that I've ever seen anyone order this and it looks pale in comparison. Skip the cold one and go with the Crazy Crab Sandwich.

I recommend maybe splitting this sandwich with someone and eating other goodies at the park.
author: Lester W.

description:
I just got mobbed by a delicious crab sandwich for $15.50.  Yes, it was $15.50 for a teeny, tiny sandwich but that's what you have to expect when dining at a sporting event.  

Crispy, buttery, garlicky grilled sourdough enfolded the shredded dungeness crab meat.  Each bite consisted of tomatoes, crab and artery clogging delicious bread.  

Worth getting my arteries clogged?  You betcha!
author: Amy L.

description: DROOOOOOL!!! Now that when i smell garlic i am reminded of how aromatic and mouthwatering my first crazy crabz sandwich was YUM!!! seriously they need to open up shop outside of the ballpark... but i guess thats one of the perks of ballpark food!!! GRUB GRUB GRUB HELL YEAH!!!
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
What's not to love about 2 pieces garlic-buttered pieces of crisp on the outside, chewy on the inside sourdough bread? Add to that a couple of tomato slices and a positively generous portion of a delicious, fresh, creamy crab concoction and you've got a winner. Don't forget to use the accompanying lemon slice. 
I would honestly make the trek to and back from the nosebleeds just to get a Crazy Crab'z sandwich, thank God I only need to walk from section 126 most of the time.
author: Veronica C.

description:
Best freaking Sandwich I've had in a long time!

Last night was the first time in years that I went to AT&T Park. I kept rationalizing that I would go back and see a game, and finally my friend dragged me to one. She kept saying that I should try this sandwich, and after getting bombarded by several photographers, we got to this mecca of CRABBY HAPPINESS. It is a bit pricey, $15.50 for a sandwich. Though I have to admit, totally worth it. Crab in some kind of sauce, in between two slices of grilled garlic sourdough bread, topped with tomato. It was one of the best sandwich experiences I had in a long time. I definitely need to go to more Giants games to just to get that sandwich fix.
author: Jenny D.

description: The best crab sandwich anywhere!! My husband and I look forward to this delight as much as the game itself! AT&T park got it right with the awesome food and drink fare along with a gorgeous park in a gorgeous location!
author: Tammi A.

description: At first I thought maybe 4 stars because of the price, but then I thought about it, and I'm pretty sure most of us have spent  $16 on worse (e.g. I bought a $20 lottery ticket a couple of days ago and lost).  Maybe one the best crab sandwiches ever (if not THE best).  I pretty much spent close to $3.00 per bite (finished my sandwich in 6 bites).  If you like seafood, lobster rolls, etc. pull out a 20 spot for one of these.  If you're REALLY hungry, buy 2 and abstain from Starbucks for a week to make up for it.
author: Gilbert U.

description:
Went to the Crazy Crab'z stand today at the Giants game today for the first time.  My wife heard it was the bomb, and I was a little sketch - but it really impressed me... especially for ball park food.

We shared the Crazy Crab'z sandwich - which was FRESH, CHUNKY crab meat on garlic sourdough toast with a couple of slices of tomato.  I was in shock that it wasn't crappy canned crab meat - this stuff was in fresh pieces.  It was hella bomb. The garlic sourdough toast was crispy and warm.

As far as ball park food, you can't get better.  BUT, it is a $15 dollar sandwich and it is SMALL.  It needs to be 50% larger, or $5 less to get 5-star status.  Until then, 4.5 stars... but tasty as hell.
author: Joel V.

description: I love going to night ball games and I love these crab sandwiches! Plenty of fresh crab on buttery garlic bread, what is not to love? Yes the line may be long, but it is well worth the wait. Only wish I could get them some place outside the park.
author: Slyf X.

description: Best crab sandwich ever!!! Came to a Giants game and the guy next to me was having one of these. It looked so delicious I had to ask him where he got it. We were sitting at the bleacher section and he said it was just right up the stairs. I had a bite and omg it was so delicious! Best $17 I ever spent in my life. And it was a decent amount of crab. Definitely your money's worth!
author: Lina M.

description:
I don't really want talk about how incredible the Crazy Crab sandwich is for three reasons:

1. the line will get EVEN longer 
2. my review will give the $15 price positive reinforcement
3. it will make me sad. oh how i wish i had a crab sandwich right now.

But I will spill, in hopes that the demand for Crazy Crab'z will FORCE them to make it available somewhere else in the city.  Picture this: a generous chunky pile of fresh crab meat grilled up with tomatoes on some buttery, garlicky sourdough toast.  Damn, that sandwich is legit.; best ballpark food ever.  In fact, because of my Crazy Crab cravings I am beginning to view my Giants tickets as $40 cover to get to the crab sandwich.  

Sorry team...I am a loyal fan (of the crab sandwich).
author: Stephanie P.

description: DEE Fucken-LICIOUS!!!! You cant go wrong by choosing to go to AT&T Park to watch The Giants kick A$$! What better way to watch a game other then eating one of these Deliciously Delicious Crab sandwiches??? The butter crisp sourdough bread adds to the flavor of the FRESH crab meat ...yeah i said it...not canned, not artificial... FRESH...umhum...they went crabbing right before the game just for us..So delicious I forgot the cost....who cares ...LETS GO GIANTS!!.
author: Dee M.

description:
At first I was afraid, I was petrified, by the cost of the crab sandwich that lay before my eyes, but alas I had to try this ghastly sandwich that I spied BEFORE MY EYES!!!  My pocketbook will survive!!!

You're such a dork. (pardon the inner monologue)

AHEM!

$15 for a crazy crab sandwich, that was much smaller than I expected, because I was looking at the crab louie and shrimp louie sandwiches that were not only cheaper, but GINORMOUS.  

But you know what?

I'd pay $15 again for that same sandwich at the ball park.  The sandwich was fresh dungeness crab in a mayo sauce, with ZERO FILLER.  The only thing in it was crab crab crab and more crab.
