It is served between two delicious halves of a garlic toasted baguette and a couple slices of tomato.  Yeah, it's questionable if it really is worth $15, but I enjoyed every last bite.

I love toasted bread.  I love garlic and I especially love dungeness crab.

Oh yeah, if you're looking for the crab shack, it's near the glove and Coca Cola slide area.
author: Amy T.

description:
This is one of the best places to eat at AT&T Park!!

FINALLY got to try the infamous crab sandwich at the last Giants game I went to!

The portions are pretty small but it is really good. They don't skimp on the crab meat either which is awesome. I especially loved the grilled sourdough garlic bread! It had a rich buttery garlic flavor and the bread had a nice crunch to it without being too hard. YUM.

The bf went to go get it for me so I have no idea how far the walk is or how expensive the sandwich is, but I know that everything at the ballpark has hiked up prices so I'm sure the crab sandwich was pretty pricey.

Definitely a must try if you are at AT&T Park!!
author: Patricia L.

description:
Awesome sandwiches!  Yeah there are long lines, but what would you expect from a place that has 40 thousand people at once?  The price is fair considering other places that not inside a ballpark that offer crab and lobster rolls for about the same price.

Can't wait for the 2012 season to start
author: Mario S.

description: Pricey crab sandwich, but worth every penny. Not sure I have ever enjoyed a sandwich as much in my entire life. Treat yourself to a mouthwatering delight!
author: Brian M.

description:
$15 for a freakin' sandwich????!!!  HELL YEA and SO worth it!!

It's not good for you (health-wise) and it's not good for your wallet ($15= 1 sandwich), but it IS good for you because you will be smiling like the cat that ate the mouse the whole time that you're eating it!!

What else is good about this sandwich other than it being ultra-yummy??  You're at the freakin' Giants game eating it!!

GOOOOO GIANTS!!!!!!!!!

p.s. goes great with a tall glass of ice cold Blue Moon!...and Go Giants, again!
author: Joanne S.

description: Outstanding - There will be a line,so suck it up. Worth the wait...
author: Renee C.

description:
I am sooooo disappointed by this and it pains me to write this review. I read about this Crazy Crabz shack while planning my trip to SF. Knowing that my BF and I were going to a Giants game, I couldn't wait to try this place! A hot crab sammich at a baseball game? Yes please! I was even willing to pay the $15 because, hey, it was vacation. 

I thought I was being SO wise by waiting until the 7th inning to get my sammich. I thought, hey it's late in the game, there will be no lines. I was right there was no line. However, I think they had stopped making new fresh sammiches a few innings ago. My "hot" $15 treat came from a display case and was not even lukewarm. The crab meat was indeed tasty and the garlic bread was crisp and buttery but cold and hard. I cried into my hot cocoa.... 

I would not venture out to Crazy Crabz again should life ever bring me back to this Stadium as there was so much other delicious food to enjoy and this experience was so sub par. 

I will however leave you with a tip for finding this "gem". It is by the glove and Coca Cola bottle side of the stadium and the small shack is located right next to the "Build a Lou Seal" shop. Enjoy...hope yours is better.
author: Jessica M.

description:
I was thinking that fifteen dollars was way too expensive for a crab sandwich.  That is until I tried one.  My goodness.  You get big chunks of crab and you could actually taste it.  It's not like other crab sandwiches where they use so many ingredients, it takes the crab flavor away.  

This has gotta be the best at the ballpark.  I'll pay $15 anyday for this.
author: Chai S.

description: It gets more expensive and smaller each year.  WORTH IT.
author: Lielen d.

description: The crazy crab sandwich? BEST SANDWICH I HAVE EVER EATEN.
author: Emily D.

description: This is ballpark food?  At ATT park this is the real deal.  A heap of Dungeness crab salad, a sliced tomato, grilled  garlic sourdough bread.  Score one for the home team!  $16 is pretty steep but it's a major league talent!
author: Eric Y.

description:
If I'm at a game and the Giants are doing well enough for my "friendly" wager that comes with financial gains to come to fruition, I just have to swing by here to splurge on a 15 dolla crab sammie.

Best money you can spend at the ball park. The garlic bread is nicely toasted and so buttery it'll give you a heart attack on the spot. The crab is really fresh and if you're a true San Franciscan you'll definitely appreciate this crustacean masterpiece.
author: Eric L.

description:
If you are ever at a Giants game (which you should be!), definitely stop by Crazy Crab'z and pick up a Crazy Crab'z Sandwich.  You will not regret it!

So maybe the price is a little on the expensive side ($15.50), but honestly what do you expect when purchasing food at a baseball game?  Everything is expensive!  Even the water!  So paying 15 bucks for a fresh, delicious crab sandwich is reasonable.

The line can be a long, but it goes by pretty fast. And when you order the sandwich they take it right off the grill and hand it to you, so you know it's hot.  The Crazy Crab'z sandwich is pretty much crab mixed with mayonnaise and placed on garlic bread.  Simple and scrumptious.  

What I loved about this sandwich was the fact that the crab mixture was creamy and smooth with chunks of real crab throughout.  At some places when I get a crab sandwich I find shell pieces throughout the sandwich, which for me does not make it very enjoyable to eat.  Here, I found no shells! Which is wonderful considering how many of these babies they pop out in a game.  On top of that, the sourdough bread they use is perfect.  It is toasted on a grill and oozing with buttery, garlic goodness.  They also place sliced tomatoes on the sandwich and lemon wedges on the side.  All ingredients compliment each other very nicely, so when you take your first bite you get a slight crunch from the toasted bread and move right on into the creamy seafood.  When you think about it, this is the perfect ballpark sandwich to represent San Francisco.

Tip:
Don't forget to grab a bunch of napkins before heading back to your seats!
author: Samantha S.

description:
If you're at a Giants game AND feeling flush, head over to get a Crazy Crab sandwich.  Probably the best food you're going to find at the park (IMHO).

Aside from beer, wine, champagne and water ... can you believe a small bottle of water costs $5 in the park??? (that's the going rate, not just at this joint).  Their menu is very limited:
Crazy Crab Sandwich - grilled in buttered baguette.
Crab Sandwich - generous amount of crab in a hoggie bun - served cold.
Crab Louie salad - comes with a hardboiled egg.

Yes, they use REAL crab.  Not imitation.

Currently, the crab louie will set you back $12.50; the crazy crab $15.50.  Not sure about the regular crab sandwich though.

The stall next to them sells a pretty good clam chowder in a bowl and fried calamari that I've been eyeing.

Oh yes, they're behind the score board.
author: Winnie C.

description:
OMG! Do I have to go to a game to get this sandwich?!?! it was simply the most delicious sandwich I have ever had. 
The hot crab sandwich. 
15.50 yes because its real crab and the bread is fresh sliced garlic bread.
A must if you are going to the ball park.
Also a tip. you can go to any of the attached vendor windows to order if the wall is connected to the shack they serve it. so dont get stuck in the crazy crabz line.
author: Sara S.

description:
If you are at a critical juncture of the game, beware!

The crazy crab sandwich is so good that it momentarily causes you to lose track of the game, since all your attention is devoted to one of the best combinations of flavors on earth: buttery, toasted bread and fresh, shredded crab.

The $15 price tag is admittedly hefty, but keep in perspective that this is ballpark grub.

If you have never had this sandwich, or have your hands on some bargain seats, I would advise trying it as soon as possible.
author: Andrew M.

description: Yum!!!!!!!!!! Crazy crabs is pure goodness!  It's a bit pricy ($16) but warm dungenes crab on sourdough is worth it!  The regular crab sandwich is cheaper, but comes on a roll and is a cold sandwich.  Also, all lines in this area are the same (crab, beer line, etc.) so go to the shortest one.  (This is inside the ballpark)
author: Michelle M.

description: This place is inside AT&T ballpark, in case you did not know. The dungeness crab sandwich is really good tasting but I just can't get over the price. If the portion was big enough, I'd be okay with it or if it came with a side or beverage.
author: Lyn T.

description: I heard great things about the hot crab sandwich from a former coworker, but I always avoided actually purchasing this sandwich because of the steep price tag ($16.50).  Well, yesterday evening I took the plunge and I have to say that I was quite pleased with my decision.  The bread is crunchy, buttery, and garlicky.  There is a hearty amount of crab, but the size of the sandwich overall is still on the small side.  I don't think I'll get this every time I go, but it's definitely worth the splurge.
author: Laura C.

description: So after waiting in line for 20 minutes, I was already feeling a little more than doubtful of the outcome. I've heard some locals rave about this place, but the pessimist in me was dubious about this tourist trap, and my doubts were confirmed after I bought the $15 crab sandwich. The bread was super greasy, so much so that I couldn't enjoy the crab. If the greasiness was purely from buttery goodness, then it would have been alright, but it mostly tasted like vegetable oil.  The crab salad consisted of only mayonnaise, so it was missing that acidic bite.  There were also no sides that came with the sandwich, and I'm a sucker for variety, so I thought that was lame.  I would not repeat patronizing a vendor that masks crab with ridiculously oily bread, no matter how buzzed I am at the Giant's game.   Don't fall for the hype.
author: Sandy K.

description: ....If you go to a game here in San Francisco be it baseball or football expect to be ripped off...that's part of the experience so enjoy it...$16 make believe crab treats, $10 beers etc.,etc.,   If you pay $100 for a ticket why complain...
author: jim b.

description: Way overpriced for the size that you get, but nontheless, delicious.
author: Jonas T.

description: My favorite meal at the Ballpark! So yummy!! It's pretty pricey but still worth it!
author: Barbra C.

description: Although I love the San Francisco Giants, I am and will always be a football girl. That being said, I go to Giants games sometimes solely for the Crazy Crab. It's quite possibly the most delicious thing I've ever put in my mouth. Do not shy away at its $16 price tag, I'd pay double. If you don't get this next time you're at AT&T Park, you're seriously missing out. Don't ask questions, just do it.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Dropped fifteen bucks on one of these babies, and it was well worth it. Had half and gave the other half to the husby, and I was LONGING for more! Next time I won't share!

I even like this better than Nick's in Pacifica!
author: RACHELLE T.

description:
I splurged and bought the $15.00 Crab Sandwich after reading all the reviews on Yelp. Ok, I expected it to be buttery, small & expensive but I wasn't prepared for how delicious it was! 

They had the perfect amount of mayo mixed in with crab & the garlic bread was crunchy & buttered. I can't wait to come back and have another one.
author: AnnaMarie S.

description: What a pleasant surprise to find this place when all that is usually offered is hot dogs and chicken tenders. Prices are just about the same as a hot dog, so why not have some seafood instead? I got the Crab Louie salad and it was hearty and filling for $12, which you would pay the same at a restaurant. My peer ordered the Craby sandwich which was on a grilled sour dough bread filled with creamy crab filling. Uh Yummo!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Took my  friend to the Dodgers/Giants game for her birthday, since she's one of them SoCal bitches. She suggested we buy a $15 crab sandwich and split it. I know she's crazy, but didn't think she was THAT crazy.

I spent the dough anyway, cause I'm a hell of a pushover. Back at our seats I took hold of my half sandwich and gave it the business. 

I have not stopped thinking about that enormously delicious sandwich ever since. It ranks as one of the top 5 between-bread meals of my life. I only wish I could have eaten the whole thing. Worth every penny.
author: Brittney G.

description: My trainer throwing his towel at me (yeah, he actually did that) flashed in my mind as I took my first bite. This hater of overly buttered bread and mayo laced salad loved every morsel! It tasted even better when chased with a Bud Light - which is very uncharacteristic for me since I don't drink alcohol! What the hell? It's September, we're on a winning streak and I'm feeling lucky! LET'S GO GIANTS!
author: Christine P.

description: OMG! This sandwich is so damn good! I mean I've heard how insanely good it is but after trying for myself I AM A BELIEVER. Yes it is $15.50 but I wouldn't even think twice about it being too expensive because it honestly isn't. Can you put a price on taste heaven? That sweet and creamy dungeness crab between two slices of buttery garlicky toasted sourdough bread with two slices of juicy tomatoes. My bf and I split the sandwich after having some garlic fries and a lemonade to quench our thirst, concludes the perfect meal at the Giant's ballpark.
author: Elaine L.

description: $15.50 for a crazy crab sandwich on garlic bread is quite ridiculous if you ask me. But trust me, the buttery goodness with the real crab meat is just absolutely delicious! I mean hey, you're getting real crab meat, so quit complaining about the price! Too bad they're all the way by the bleachers because my season tickets are at the other end of the stadium.... BUT that doesn't stop me from going through the crowd of people to get my hands on this ridiculously priced sandwich.
author: Eugenia G.

description: Best crab sandwich ever! Too bad it's so tiny and for $16 i would expect a bigger sandwich but oh well. I'll fork over my $16 just to have this again and again.
author: Joy O.

description: I am allergic to crab. I still eat the Crazy Crab sandwich (the $15) because it is so freakin delicious!!! NOM NOM NOM.... buttery, creamy, crab goodness. Everytime I come to the Giants game I have to get a sandwich. Granted I could get itchy and breakout in hives, its worth the risk to me! NOM NOM NOM
author: Julie F.

description: Must eat the crazy crab'z sandwich. It's super fresh and delicious!
author: Lisa C.

description: The portion was tiny (I got a hot dog later to add to the 4 bites from the sandwich), and shortly after eating it, I felt like I was going to have a heart attack. Some people like paying $16 for two pieces of bread swimming in butter and mayo with a little bit of crab in it. I will not be eating there again.
author: David S.

description: I'm drooling looking at the pictures. I want one!!!! This is the only reason I like going to Giants games! lol Go A's! But seriously, this sandwich is amazing and worth every penny!
author: C M.

description:
I could probably eat about a half dozen of these Crazy Crab'z sandwiches, and it'll only set me back a cool benjamin. These things seriously kick the ass of any lobster roll I've eaten in Boston. I love how the natural sweetness and flavor of the crab meat comes through when you bite into it, and it's not overpowered by too much mayo or filler. Using freshly grilled garlic and butter baguette is brilliant, as it definitely kicks the sandwich up another notch. 

If you think about it, it's not too difficult to make this sandwich yourself, and definitely cheaper for sure. I'm going to have a Crazy Crab'z sandwich backyard party at my house. Who's in? Ha!
author: Dru C.

description: Sanwiches are small but flavors are amazing! Best sandwich at a ballpark ever! Maybe a little too much butter on the grilled sourdough but I would still get it again.
author: N C.

description:
had to come here after reading the yelp reviews... and thank you Sam L for noting the exact location of this place... haha behind the bleachers!

ok, i have to admit, our ball park is GREAT that it offers so much variety of food and not just limited to hot dogs and fries... and having a crab melt at the park is definitely a plus! 

the crazy crab sandwich $15 is dungeness crab on grilled sourdough and the regular crab sandwich is $10.75.  both of the sandwiches were ok, but not the best crab'wich ever... the sourdough of the crazy crab'wich is grilled... no no... almost fried in herb butter... it definitely entices the nose! but once you bite into the sandwich... umm... u'll noticed that your fingers will be drenched in butter....  the regular crab sandwich is just crab salad on a bun... the bun is thick... and not moist... prob cuz it's been sitting in the refrigerated section of the crab stand. 

if i had to get another, i'll prob go with the greasy crazy crab... tastier even tho it's SO oily.... but i still think sheboygan brats loaded is the way to go at the park
author: Kelly H.

description:
mouthgasm! i mean its pretty darn pricey for a sandwich ($16!) but dayyyyyyammmm! it is seriously the best fricking sandwich ever! who knew that sourdough bread cooked in butter with tons of crab meat would be so amazing?! 

i purposely go to a giants game at least once a year JUST so i can go to crazy crab'z and order their crab sandwich. it's all i talk about during the game and my friends actually have to hold me down to prevent me from getting seconds. my crab sandwich raving usually convince my friends to try it as well. result? they end up having to tie themselves to their seats just so they can't get seconds too!
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description:
I remember reading these reviews a long time ago, only to then realize that Crazy Crab'z was in the ballpark! Since I don't go to games much, I bookmarked it and it was placed on the back burner. The far back burner.

But imagine my surprise this week when Boyfriend comes home with 2 free Giants tickets! He's started at a new job and they're in the process of kissing his ass to make him want to work there post law school... We're going to another free Giants game later today.

Anyhow, once I was in the park I remembered that there was this Crab place I'd read about on Yelp. I did a lap around the ballpark (avoiding the security because apparently you can't go into this area anymore without seats in those sections). I eventually found Crazy Crab'z, though it concerns me because apparently only a certain portion of Giants fans can "legally" access it!

HOly Crap?! 15 bucks?! The price gave me pause, but I was curious so I tried it. The verdict? It was good- I'm picky about the freshness of seafood and the crab was tasty, fresh, no shells, and well seasoned. It's served on thick buttery garlic toast, which actually feels like too much bread in proportion to the filling. I wound up eating it open-faced to make the bread to crab ratio better.

It was good, but not earth-shattering. Way better than you'd expect in a ballpark, but it's still in a ballpark.
author: Amanda C.

description: The crab sandwhich is EASILY worth the $15.50 price.  Amazing.  Also, you dont need to go to each individual booth to get your specific order, any of the food booths next to it will serve the others food.
author: Rob M.

description: 15.50 for a crab sandwich on delish sourdough... yes. Worth every penny...and every bite. I love me some crab. Our 6 and 4YOs loved the sandwiches too... so goooooood!
author: Queen S.

description:
I thought $15 for a crab sandwich was insane, but that was before I was introduced to AT&T Park's $7 hot dogs and $8 bottles of (ick!) Bud Light. So, comparatively, the sandwich was a good deal since it wasn't a FRICKING $7 HOT DOG. The $10 cold dungeness crab sandwich may be a little cheaper but it looks nasty, like something you'd find in a vending machine.

Anyway, the crazy crab is delicious. Tasty garlic bread and lots of sweet, sweet crab - yum! In the alternate reality of baseball park dining, it's worth it.
author: Booda B.

description: YUMMMMY. I never get anything else but the crab sandwich. Some may think it's only an appetizer, but it does fill me up! Only giving it 4 stars because it is pretty pricey for $15.50. The combo of crab and butter soaked sourdough is DELISH. We got their an hour early before the game started and there was no line. It was a weeknight so maybe that is why there was not a wait.
author: Raquel S.

description: Saw the reviews on this place and had to try it for myself! Got to the game early and jumped right into what was starting to become rather long line. My friends, fiance, and I agreed that the garlicy scent was mouth-watering and a cruel, cruel way to convince folks in line that, "yes, if you wait 30 minutes and give us $15, you will be happy". And so, it turned out to be true. I agree that the crab sandwich could stand to be a bit bigger, especially for the price, but it did deliver on flavor. In the end, I spent about $32 for 2 sandwiches + tax. I will probably buy another at a future game, but only on pay day.
author: Tiffany E.

description: The crazy crab sandwich is probably the most expensive thing you'll find in the ballpark at $15... But it's worth EVERY penny. Sometimes I find myself needing to buy 2 of them because they're that good. It is also one of the few things in the ballpark that they actually rub out of during the game, so if you want one, I HIGHLY recommend getting it early in the game.
author: Ted C.

description: Awesome Crazy Crab sandwich. Be prepared to fork out $15 for it though. Include fries and a coke and your at $25.
author: David W.

description: Um yea, this sandwich was worth the $15.  My husband and I were visiting San Francisco last weekend and had the opportunity to go to a Giants game.  We were getting a beer near center field when we both smelled the wondeful scent of garlic.  We saw the line was very long for the sandwich and decided to check it out later.  Finally when the initial long line had subsided, we each ponied up $15 for this piece of heaven and were not disappointed in the least.  Yum Yum Yum.  If they didn't cost $15, we would have split another one.
author: Meg C.

description: Way better the having a hott dog at the game
author: Michael P.

description: Best ballpark food by far that I've had.  Wish I paired it up with some garlic fries but the sandwich is really good.  $15 for a crab sandwich ain't bad considering you're already paying $30 for parking.
author: Glen G.

description: If you've yet to experience Crab'z, you need to get some action in your life.
author: Stef H.

description:
Crazy Crabz you disappoint!  If I'm paying $15 for a sandwich it better be GREAT not mediocre.  

Go here if you like your sandwiches drenched in butter and running down your hands and crab meat that has so much mayo that you can barely taste the crab.
author: Tina A.

description: Freakin great sammich! Great view. Would be a five.  but @15 BUCKS c'mon add some fries or chips to that !  Get us a championship and I'll have crazy crabz for breakfast lunch and dinner. But I Was only introduced to it last season and had so many one nite I couldn't finish the final one.. So Rich vs food   .. Food 1.   Rich-- well  it keeps going and going and going..
author: Rich L.

description:
i LOVE crab, and i had been wanting to try this sandwich since seeing these yelp reviews a while back.  usually when i go to giants games, i don't make it out to the bleacher area, so i was never able to get this sandwich.  however, last night, i had some bleacher seats and decided that i had to get this sandwich.  right when i arrived at the park, i made a beeline for this stand.  my bf even made fun of me for being so focused on getting a sandwich.  i told him not to mess w/ a hungry woman on a mission.

anyway, the sandwich is definitely not cheap, but $15 is not much more to spend than a $5 pretzel, and it is much more tasty!  the sourdough bread is grilled to buttery goodness, and they give you a signficant amount of crab.  the cold crab sandwich is cheaper and bigger, but if you want grilled bread, get the crazy crab sandwich.  you won't be disappointed!
author: Helen T.

description:
the only reason why i love going to  giants games...for the crazy crab'z sandwich.

i've only been to 2 giants games this season (i'm an A's fan by the way) and everytime i'm there i'm always gonna head over to this place! omg, this sandwich is the shit! but  expensive as hell! The sign "Crazy Crab'z" caught my eye. i LOVE crab so i had to check it out and see what it was all about. i was hungry but did i really want to spend $15 on a crab sandwich? i was kind of reluctant at first but i was like "fuckit, i'm just gonna try it . how often am i at the giants stadium..." omg, that shit was hella good!! the second time i was at the stadium, i HAD to have it! it only took me less than 15 minutes to inhale that shit. i want more. i think i'm going through crazy crab withdrawals right about now. hahah. too bad they only have this place at giants games...
author: B B.

description: bomb ass chunks of crab at the ball park! ballin boss status and hella good!
author: MENG D.

description: YUM! The crab sandwich is pricey but well worth it!  They use real crab in their crab salad and spread it on toasted garlic bread.  It is to die for!
author: Kymberli C.

description:
Paying $15 for a crab sandwich is nearly the definition of insanity. You know you shouldn't do it, but you do it any way. You cry when you take your first bite, realizing that this sandwich is one of the best things you've ever eaten at a ballpark, but also remembering that it cost 15-fucking-dollars.

When I win the lottery, I will eat here again.
author: Alexis C.

description: I totally agree with the previous 2 reviewers. I was shocked at the price and size but damn near MELTED when I tasted this sandwich. I still dream of it occasionally and talk about it often. I'm so sad that the ball park is the only place I can get one. No other crab sandwich since then has ever compared. Next time, I'm bring $30 just for sandwiches! and don't even think about asking me to share.
author: Zainab H.

description: I got the crazy crabz sammie because when you are in line you smell the garlic on the grill, and damn does it smell good. Nice amount of crab meat, tho a little too much mayo. Worth $15? I don' t know. Ballparks tend to be pricy, but $5 more just for grilled garlic bread? I'll have to try the dungeness crab sammie ($10.50) to know if my extra 5 bucks are worth it.
author: Cara H.

description:
pretty tasty!  i'm going to disagree with the garlic bread though. i think it's better if you get it on plain bread and save yourself $5. you can't really taste the salad that much with the garlic and the butter on the bread.

expensive but worth it.
author: J S.

description: Well.... After all the wonderful reviews, I had to try it!  Ironically, I was looking for good another good seafood restaurant in San Francisco proper, and found this *before* I realized this was a Giants Ballgame concession.  I'm a Giants fanatic, and had not tried this spot before.  Ever since Orlando's opened up on the third deck, I haven't visited behind the bleacher much.  Anyway, this sandwich was as good tasting as anyone here has stated.  Also, the price for ballpark food was a great deal.  However, the size of this sandwich is TINY and if you're truly looking for a great crab sandwich go to Nick's in Pacifica.  It's 20 bux, it's about four times the size, and comes with fries.  Granted, it's not at AT&T/SBC/PacBell park and available during Giants games.  Being the tiny guy/small eater I am, my friend and I finished our crab sandwich and then split a Cha Cha bowl after that...  Tim Lincecum pitched a doozy, and a 9 to 4 win over the Dodgers made this one of the best crab sandwiches I've ever had.  That and they serve Stella as well!
author: Chris C.

description:
mmm

crab sandwich, delicioso. i've been looking for a delicious crab sandwich in the city, and this damn delivered. yes, the price tag is hefty and questionably not worth it, but it was worth the one-time experience and deliciousness.

soudough bread, sliced on the bias. toasted with garlicky herb butter on the outside. a medium slather of (real!) crab and mayo all up inside with slices of tomato. it was about 97 degrees at the game today, but that sandwich made it all worth it. 

i love you, sandwich. if i ever go to another sweltering baseball game, i will purchase you and give you some damn good loving. unfortunately, everything else was hot and godawfully expensive. by the way, its in the park, so don't go looking for it elsewhere. way up in the back next to the beautiful bay.

ps i miss you, you crazy crazy crab'z.
author: Jade L.

description: the best crab sandwich i've ever tasted. it's lump crab meat mixed with a touch of mayo sandwiched between slices of buttery toasted garlic baguette. i think there are at least 4 crab legs' worth of meat in that sammy. Yes it's $15, but considering the prices of everything else at the ball park, i don't think it's overpriced. and it was so filling i didn't even want garlic fries after.
author: Vivian A.

description: The grilled sourdough crab sandwich is outstanding!  although overpriced @ $15.00 and rather small.  You can easily demolish two of these back to back.
author: Eric L.
